video_caption: The video features a man with a bald head and a beard, wearing a white t-shirt with the logo "ISHIBASHI MUSIC" and a lanyard around his neck, holding a microphone and speaking in front of a large poster at a trade show booth. The poster displays a black and white image of a man with long hair and a beard playing a bass guitar, with the text "Warwick Basses, Amps & Rock 'n' Roll" above the image. The man appears to be conducting an interview or providing commentary about the Warwick brand, which specializes in musical instruments. The setting is a bustling trade show environment with various booths and displays in the background, including a "FISHMAN" booth and a "SYSTEMS" booth. The atmosphere is lively, with other attendees and exhibitors visible in the background. The man in the white t-shirt is later joined by another man with long hair and a beard, who is wearing a dark t-shirt and has his arms crossed. The two men engage in conversation, with the man in the white t-shirt holding the microphone towards the other man, indicating an ongoing interview or discussion. The text at the bottom of the screen reads "Jason from ISHIBASHI MUSIC Shibuya, Tokyo Leland Sklar at the Warwick booth, NAMM 2015," providing context about the individuals and the event. The video captures the dynamic interaction between the two men against the backdrop of the trade show, highlighting the promotional activities of the Warwick brand.

The video captures a lively scene at a music trade show, where two men are engaged in a conversation. The man on the left, wearing a white t-shirt with the text "ISHIBASHI MUSIC" and a lanyard with a badge, holds a microphone and appears to be interviewing the man on the right, who has a long white beard and is dressed in a dark t-shirt. The backdrop features a large poster of a man playing a bass guitar, with the text "Warwick Basses, Amps" visible, indicating the brand being showcased. The setting is bustling with activity, as other attendees and exhibitors can be seen in the background, contributing to the vibrant atmosphere of the event. The interaction between the two men is the focal point, with the interviewer gesturing and speaking into the microphone while the interviewee listens attentively, occasionally responding. The overall ambiance is one of professional engagement and enthusiasm for music-related products and discussions.

The video captures an interview taking place at a bustling convention center, where a bald man wearing a white T-shirt with the "ISHIBASHI MUSIC" logo and a lanyard is holding a microphone and interviewing an older man with a long white beard and glasses. The older man, dressed in a dark gray T-shirt, stands with his arms crossed, listening attentively. Behind them, a large poster features an image of the older man playing a guitar, adding a personal touch to the setting. The background is filled with various booths and attendees, creating a lively atmosphere. As the interview progresses, text overlays appear on the screen, listing song titles and artists, such as "Rita Coolidge," "Lady's Not For Sale," "Fall Into Spring," and "It's Only Love," suggesting a discussion about music. The scene remains consistent, with the interviewee occasionally gesturing with his hands while speaking, and the interviewer maintaining a focused demeanor. The video effectively conveys the dynamic interaction between the interviewer and the interviewee, set against the vibrant backdrop of the convention.

The video captures an interview taking place at a music convention, where a bald man wearing a white t-shirt with the "Ishibashi Music" logo is holding a microphone and interviewing an older man with a long white beard and glasses. The older man is dressed in a dark t-shirt and stands with his arms crossed, listening attentively to the interviewer. Behind them, a large poster displays an image of the same older man playing a guitar, adding a visual context to the interview. The background reveals a bustling convention hall with various booths and attendees, creating a lively atmosphere. The text "Ishibashi Music" is prominently displayed on the interviewer's shirt and in the top right corner of the screen, indicating the affiliation of the event. The video maintains a consistent setting throughout, with the interviewee and interviewer engaged in a conversation, while the convention environment remains active in the background.

The video features an interview at a music convention, where a bald man wearing a white T-shirt with the "Ishibashi Music" logo and a lanyard is holding a microphone and interviewing an older man with a long white beard and glasses, who is dressed in a dark T-shirt. The background displays a large poster of the bearded man playing a bass guitar, and the convention hall is bustling with activity, including various booths and attendees. Throughout the interview, an inset video in the top left corner shows different live concert performances, including a man playing a guitar on stage, a band performing with vibrant lighting, and a man singing into a microphone. The inset video transitions between these performances, showcasing the energy and atmosphere of live music events. The Ishibashi Music logo and the number "4400" are visible in the top right corner of the screen, indicating the booth number at the convention. The interview continues with the interviewer and interviewee engaged in conversation, while the inset video provides a dynamic backdrop of live music performances.

The video features an interview at a music convention, with a man wearing a white "Ishibashi Music" t-shirt holding a microphone and interviewing another man with a long white beard. The interviewer is wearing a lanyard with an ID badge, and the interviewee is dressed in a dark t-shirt. In the background, a large poster of a musician playing a bass guitar is visible. The setting is a bustling convention hall with various booths and attendees. Throughout the video, an inset screen in the top left corner displays different scenes from a live music performance, including a close-up of a musician singing into a microphone and a wider shot of the stage with multiple performers. The atmosphere is lively, with the interview taking place amidst the vibrant energy of the convention.

The older man is dressed in a dark T-shirt and is gesturing with his hands while speaking. The video features an interview at a music trade show, where a bald man wearing a white T-shirt with the "Ishibashi Music" logo and a lanyard is holding a microphone and interviewing a man with long white hair and a beard, who is wearing a dark T-shirt. They are standing in front of a large poster of the same man playing a bass guitar, with the text "Lee Sklar" and "The First Canadian Musical Company in the Music Industry" visible on the poster. The interviewee gestures towards the poster, pointing out details of the bass guitar, while the interviewer listens attentively. The background shows a busy exhibition hall with various booths and attendees walking around. The atmosphere is professional and focused on music-related discussions.

The video captures an engaging interview at a music convention, featuring two individuals prominently. The interviewer, dressed in a white T-shirt with the "ISHIBASHI MUSIC" logo, holds a professional microphone, indicating a formal interview setup. The interviewee, distinguished by his long white beard and glasses, wears a dark T-shirt and appears to be a musician, as suggested by the large poster behind them depicting a similar figure playing a guitar. The backdrop includes the text "Rock 'n' Roll," reinforcing the musical theme of the event. The setting is bustling with other convention attendees and booths, creating a lively atmosphere. Throughout the video, the interviewee gestures expressively, indicating an animated conversation, while the interviewer maintains a focused demeanor, capturing the interview with the microphone. The interaction between the two is dynamic, with the interviewee's gestures and the interviewer's attentive stance contributing to the engaging nature of the scene.

In the video, two men are engaged in a conversation at a music convention. The man on the left, wearing a white T-shirt with the "Ishibashi Music" logo and a lanyard around his neck, holds a microphone and appears to be interviewing the man on the right. The man on the right, with long white hair and a beard, is dressed in a dark T-shirt and listens attentively. Behind them, a large poster features a similar image of a man with a long beard holding a guitar, with the text "Rock 'n' Roll" visible. In the video, a man with a bald head and a beard, wearing a white t-shirt with the text "ISHIBASHI MUSIC" and a lanyard around his neck, is holding a microphone and interviewing another man with long white hair and a beard, who is wearing glasses and a dark-colored shirt. They are standing in front of a backdrop featuring a large image of a man with a long white beard playing a guitar, with the text "Rock 'n' Roll" visible. The setting appears to be a convention or trade show, as indicated by the booths and displays in the background. The interviewer is actively speaking and gesturing with his free hand, while the interviewee listens attentively and occasionally responds. The video features a man with a long white beard and glasses, wearing a dark gray t-shirt, standing in front of a backdrop with the text "Warwick Rock 'n' Roll" and an image of himself playing a guitar. He is being interviewed by another man wearing a white t-shirt with the "Ishibashi Music" logo, who holds a microphone and a recording device. The setting appears to be a music trade show, with various booths and displays visible in the background. The interviewer, identified as Jason from Ishibashi Music, is seen speaking to the bearded man, who listens attentively. Text overlays provide context, stating "Jason from Ishibashi Music Shibuya, Tokyo" and "Leland Sklar at the Warwick booth, NAMM 2015," along with the website "www.ishibashi.co.jp" and a Facebook link "www.facebook.com/IshibashiMusicJapan." The video concludes with a dynamic red graphic featuring the "Ishibashi Music" logo, emphasizing the brand's presence.
